product.title: It's Not Easy Being A Bunny | Book Club by Early Moments
product.text:
It's Not Easy Being a Bunny
by Marilyn Sadler

P.J. Funnybunny is miserable eating cooked carrots, having big ears, and playing with his siblings in the classic, It's Not Easy Being a Bunny. He tries to start a new life as a bear, a pig, a moose, and even a skunk. But P.J. doesn't fit in. He finally returns home to the delight of his family. P.J. learns that he is the happiest when his family is around. It's Not Easy Being a Bunny is a wonderful tool that emphasizes the importance of families and self-worth.

Tie-in Activity: Consider making an ordinary family dinner special by creating a feel-good family tablecloth. Cover the table with an inexpensive, plain paper tablecloth, and give everyone some crayons. Talk about what you like about your family and each other, and write it down on the tablecloth. Kids can also draw pictures. If dinner is fairly spill-free, you might save the cloth to use again.
